main.name: Isabel Tripp
main.bio: I'm always down to talk about sustainable agriculture, minimalism, technology policy, national parks, ultimate frisbee, or science fiction books. I chose software engineering as a career because I can take my skills to any of the myriad industries that interest me as a multipotentialite. Another important thing to know is that I'm on a quest to find the world's most "perfect" cinnamon bun. Currently in the lead: my dad's recipe + Zeit F√ºr Brot in Berlin.
main.contactmessage: What's your favorite art museum? What technologies do you think can mitigate the effects of climate change? Any tips for learning how to surf? Drop me a line and I'll get back to you as soon as possible.

resume.skillmessage: Most of my professional experience has been in full-stack app/web development roles. I love collaboration and working in a team. I've highlighted a few skills below but the list is not exhaustive.

education.degree: B.S. in Computer Science, with Math minor
education.description: Member of the University Honors Program. Orgs I'm involved in include: NU CS Mentoring Organization (mentor), NU Women in Tech Club (former Outreach Chair), HackBeanpot (hackathon organizer), club ultimate frisbee (player), NU Students Against Institutional Discrimintation.

work.company: Institute for Astronomy ‚Äî University of Hawaii üî≠
work.title: Computing Research Assistant
work.description: Building software for the ATLAS project, a NASA-funded intitative to identify near-Earth asteroids.

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: I built cellular automata models of stem-cell-driven tissue growth and exposed the models to the public through a website and API.

work.title: Software Developer Co-op
work.description: I helped develop an internal app for farmers working in modular, hydroponic, cloud-connected, urban farms across the country.

work.title: Software Engineering Fellow
work.description: I designed and developed a complete proof-of-concept for rebuilding outdated conflict diamond trade analytics software. I worked at Census after being selected for the 2019 Civic Digital Fellowship.

work.title: Software Developer Co-op
work.description: I worked on features for an energy intelligence application used by companies to predict market trends.
